title: How long can you be unconscious before brain damage occurs? - Quora

response.answer_text: It’s not a question of whether you’re unconscious, it’s a question of whether the brain is receiving sufficient oxygen. If the oxygen supply is cut off for whatever the reason, you have a matter of minutes before your brain begins to die. I’d have to look up the exact number, I’m sure you can find it easily. Just being unconscious by itself doesn’t damage your brain, although whatever made you lose consciousness may have done some damage, or it may still be damaging you, for example if you’re being poisoned. But people are placed in drug-induced comas for days at a time for medical reasons. And of course you’re unconscious when you’re anesthetized for surgery, often for several hours.

You got it backward. Unconsciousness does not cause brain injury, it is normally the result of brain injury. As they say in the health field, unconsciousness is a symptom, not a condition. You can be unconscious for an extended perioid, as in a medically induced coma, without the unconsciousness damaging your mind. Conversely, a severe head blow, or a lack of oxygen, can cause even life-ending brain damage without a significant interval of unconsciousness at all.
